meanings.definition: Not made sore by rubbing or chafing.
meanings.sent1: Her skin felt ungalled after applying the soothing cream.
meanings.sent2: The soft fabric left his skin ungalled and comfortable.
meanings.sent3: Even after a long hike, his feet remained ungalled and pain-free.
meanings.sent4: The protective gloves kept her hands ungalled from the rough work.
meanings.sent5: The gentle touch of the nurse left the patient's skin ungalled and calm.

meanings.sent1: Despite the delay, she remained ungalled and patient.
meanings.sent2: He stayed ungalled even when faced with criticism.
meanings.sent3: The playful teasing left him ungalled and smiling.
meanings.sent4: Her calm demeanor kept her ungalled amidst the chaos.
meanings.sent5: The kind words left her ungalled and content.

meanings.sent1: The clear path allowed the travelers to move ungalled.
meanings.sent2: The efficient system ensured the process was ungalled.
meanings.sent3: The well-organized event ran ungalled and smoothly.
meanings.sent4: His focused mindset kept his progress ungalled.
meanings.sent5: The open communication channels kept the project ungalled and on track.
